project.teaser: The region of South Marmara is ideally placed, geographically, economically, and politically to take up the challenge of developing and implementing a hydrogen valley in 2023 and help to build towards the national Turkish goal to be carbon free by 2053. South Marmara is...
project.objective: The region of South Marmara is ideally placed, geographically, economically, and politically to take up the challenge of developing and implementing a hydrogen valley in 2023 and help to build towards the national Turkish goal to be carbon free by 2053. South Marmara is situated between the largest metropolitan areas of Türkiye (Istanbul to the north, Izmir to the southwest and Bursa to the east. It is bordered by the Aegean Sea to the west and the Sea of Marmara to the north which gives it unlimited access to water. The South Marmara region has set a clear vision to reach a carbon-neutral economy by 2053 by phasing-out fossil-fuel utilization in all sectors and green hydrogen will play a critical role in this path. The HYSouthMarmara project is the first step of this vision and it will; - Create a detailed roadmap which sets out recommendations up to 2035 and beyond in terms of establishing a regional hydrogen economy - Design, deploy and install a Polymer Electrolyte Membrane (PEM) electrolyser with a minimum 4MW of power to reach annual hydrogen production of 500 tonnes - Develop and implement a digital twin of the hydrogen production system that will create the flexibility for renewable energy usage and efficient production of green hydrogen - Create the South Marmara Hydrogen Backbone by determining the infrastructure requirements for the storage, transport and deployment of the green hydrogen - Demonstrate the uptake and replacement of grey hydrogen with green hydrogen in two industries, hydrogen peroxide production and glass manufacturing - Conceive and build a kiln to use hydrogen as a fuel in energy-intensive ceramic industrial processes - Develop Sodium Borohydride plant and use it as a basis for a power supply - Explore and create new markets for the use of green hydrogen and its liquid and solid derivatives - Create a meaningful communication plan to show to public and stakeholders the benefits of green hydrogen and help other regions to creat
project.title: South Marmara Hydrogen Shore
project.keywords: South Marmara, roadmap, Polymer Electrolyte Membrane electrolyser, replacement of grey hydrogen, ceramic manufacturing, Sodium Borohydride power supply, Green Methanol, Green Ammonia

result.title: Feasibility Report of Large-scale Green Ammonia Plant
result.description: TAU will conduct a feasibility study for the production of another hydrogen derivative: green ammonia, if the technical and economic terms are reasonable for a large-scale green methanol plant, it is planned to make the investment during the project implementation. The potential investor is İÇDAŞ (steel producer).

result.title: Feasibility Report of Large-scale Green Methanol Plant
result.description: TAU will conduct a feasibility study for the Green Methanol Plant. Regarding the results of the feasibility study, if the technical and economic terms are reasonable for a large-scale green methanol plant, it is planned to make the investment during the project implementation. The potential investors are Enerjisa Üretim, and Akçansa Çimento. The produced methanol is planned to be transferred to two different locations in South Marmara, where most of the material will be used as a feedstock in the process of wood-based panel production and a small fraction of green methanol will be used in the production of boron-based chemicals. The production of this special boron chemical needs both methanol and pure hydrogen in the process.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan
result.description: The dissemination, exploitation and communication plan should be updated as necessary. The Clean Hydrogen JU may require the submission of an updated Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication Plan on an annual basis

result.title: Risk Management Register
result.description: Project Coordinator will perform the project risk analysis, identifying risks and proposing mitigation strategies. Risk factors and dependencies will be identified. For each identified risk, there will be a proposed prevention plan and/or necessary action plan. Foreseen risks will be continuously monitored, and any potential unforeseen risks will be notified promptly to the PC/SC to take quick remedy actions.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - HYSouthMarmara (South Marmara Hydrogen Shore)
result.teaser: The South Marmara region is strategically positioned to develop a hydrogen valley, supporting Turkiye’s 2053 carbon neutrality goal. Located between major cities and bordered by the Aegean and Marmara Seas, it leads in renewable capacity (3 GW) but still holds untapped...

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: DMP will include information on: i) the handling of research data; ii) what data will be collected, processed and generated; iii) applied methodology & standards; iv) shared vs. made open access; v) data preservation (also after the end of the project). PwC will draft a first version of the DMP and will update it as data sets are produced during the project.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
